exec: //tests["Response time is less than 5000ms"] = responseTime < 5000;   //validate response time
tests["Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;            //validate status code
tests["Status code name has string"] = responseCode.name.has("OK");
tests["Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;            //validate status code
tests["Status code name has string"] = responseCode.name.has("OK");
tests["Response Body contains isEDCInstanceDeleted tag"] = responseBody.has("isEDCInstanceDeleted");
tests["Response Body contains flag tag"] = responseBody.has("flag");
tests["Response Body contains activity tag"] = responseBody.has("activity");
tests["Response Body contains isSmartClientGroup tag"] = responseBody.has("isSmartClientGroup");
tests["Response Body contains isAddinClientGroup tag"] = responseBody.has("isAddinClientGroup");
tests["Response Body contains revision tag"] = responseBody.has("revision");
tests["Response Body contains name tag"] = responseBody.has("name");

request.description:
This operation returns a list of client computer groups.

http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_client_group.htm

response.name: Client Group14

tests["Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;            //validate status code

tests["Validate clientGroupName in the response"] = jsonData.clientGroupDetail.clientGroup.clientGroupName == clientGroupName ;
tests["Validate the jobsStartTime in response"] = jsonData.clientGroupDetail.jobStartTime == postman.getEnvironmentVariable("jobStartTime");
